alert.note: Alert for Hitchcock (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Goodland (Northwestern Kansas and East Central Colorado)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 26 at 9:45AM CDT until May 29 at 6:00AM CDT by NWS Goodland
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Nebraska... Republican River At Stratton affecting Hitchcock County. ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Nebraska... Frenchman Creek Near Culbertson affecting Hitchcock County. For the Republican River...including Mccook 1se, Stratton, Benkelman 1sw...Major flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL MONDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Frenchman Creek Near Culbertson. * WHEN...Until Monday morning. * IMPACTS...At 8.0 feet, Lowland areas near the vicinity of the gage will become flooded. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:15 AM CDT Friday the stage was 5.7 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage late this morning to a crest of 11.3 feet just after midnight tonight. It will then fall below flood stage Sunday evening. - Flood stage is 8.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 9.9 feet on 08/09/2008. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Flooding is occurring or is imminent. Most flood related deaths occur in automobiles. Do not attempt to cross water covered bridges, dips, or low water crossings. Never try to cross a flowing stream, even a small one, on foot. To escape rising water find another route over higher ground. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this evening at 945 PM CDT.
